intro: Jaltomata lojae, commonly known as the Loja nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom at night. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinct, often aromatic scent. Jaltomata lojae is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
